location: Teterboro, Bergen County, New Jersey, USA

primary: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey (PANYNJ) official documentation
Teterboro Users Group noise abatement procedures

operational_hours.notes: 24/7 operations with control tower. However, voluntary restraint on non-essential flights 23:00-06:00 local time due to noise restrictions.
operational_hours.lighting: High-intensity runway lights, operational sunset to sunrise

slot_requirements.slot_availability_typical: No formal slot system; operations on first-come, first-served basis
slot_requirements.peak_congestion_times: Business hours (08:00-17:00 weekdays), summer thunderstorm season (May-September), holiday periods
slot_requirements.notes: NYC airspace proximity creates coordination requirements but no formal slots. Check NOTAM for current capacity status.

weather_vulnerability.snow_closure_frequency: Occasional (2-5 events annually) - rare full closure
weather_vulnerability.cat_capability: ILS approach available; CAT II/III capable
weather_vulnerability.weather_patterns: Temperate continental climate. Winter: occasional snow (avg 24 inches annually), ice events. Spring/Summer: thunderstorms (peak July-August). Fall: generally stable.
weather_vulnerability.sea_level_rise_vulnerability: High - projected sea-level rise 3 feet by end of century could cause permanent flooding
weather_vulnerability.thunderstorm_risk: Significant summer risk (July-August peak) - accounts for major delays and congestion

runway_specifications.weight_restrictions: Maximum ramp weight 100,000 lbs; taxiway width (50 feet) limits aircraft size
runway_specifications.notes: Limited runway length (max 7,000 ft) restricts large corporate jets and commercial aircraft. Narrow taxiways create operational constraints.
runway_specifications.weight_impact: Aircraft exceeding 100,000 lbs ramp weight not permitted

hot_spots.risk: Confusion between taxiway and runway - safety hazard

crew_requirements.cat_ii_iii_rating_required: Recommended - some procedures require instrument capability
crew_requirements.minimum_pilot_hours: Private pilot certificate minimum; instrument rating recommended
special_training: Knowledge of NYC Class B airspace procedures
Familiarity with Teterboro hotspots and taxiway confusion areas
Line Up and Wait (LUAW) procedure compliance
crew_requirements.notes: FAA provides detailed pilot briefing materials. New or changed-ownership jet aircraft require pre-flight coordination.

handling_complexity.notes: Excellent handling infrastructure. Multiple FBO options allow competitive service. US Customs pre-clearance available.
handling_complexity.handling_capacity: Not a constraint - multiple operators provide robust ground services

congestion_metrics.airspace_complexity: High - New York Class B airspace (KLGA, KJFK, KEWR nearby)
congestion_metrics.atc_delays_frequency: Common during peak hours and summer thunderstorm season
congestion_metrics.notes: Congestion primarily airspace-related rather than airport-related. Summer thunderstorms cause significant delays. Holiday periods moderate impact.
congestion_metrics.current_delay_status: Generally available with 15-minute taxi delays typical

permits_and_clearances.notes: Jet-powered aircraft must obtain permission from Airport Manager (new operators or ownership changes). Permission to Operate form required.
permits_and_clearances.international_flights: US Customs pre-clearance available - 2-hour notice required

noise_restrictions.chapter_requirements: Chapter 3 or better; Chapter 2 aircraft prohibited
noise_restrictions.noise_surcharges: Yes - violations assessed in addition to potential operational restrictions
preferred_departure_routes: Avoid noise-sensitive routes over Hackensack University Medical Center
noise_restrictions.noise_complaints_risk: High - airport surrounded by residential areas and medical facility
noise_restrictions.dalton_procedure: Recommended for noise reduction - VFR departure with IFR pickup in air

infrastructure_reliability.winter_maintenance: Runway 6/24 prioritized for snow removal; taxiways maintained for FBO access

security_requirements.security_screening_time_avg: 0 minutes (general aviation facility - no TSA screening)
security_requirements.notes: General aviation facility without TSA screening - major advantage for private operations. Standard airport security protocols.

seasonal_factors.ski_season_congestion: Moderate - indirect impact from NYC ski travel (not direct airport focus)
seasonal_factors.summer_thunderstorm_frequency: High - peak July-August (30-40 days with thunderstorm activity)
seasonal_factors.notes: Summer thunderstorms primary seasonal challenge. Winter snow/ice less frequent but impactful when occurs. Business travel patterns influence weekday congestion.

backup_alternates.name: Newark Liberty International
backup_alternates.notes: Major international hub, more flight options

alternate_airport_proximity.notes: Multiple excellent alternates available. Sea-level rise projections affect long-term viability of KTEB and KLGA. Stewart International (SWF) discussed as future alternate.

payment_and_fees.handling_agent_prepayment: Not required but common for fuel
payment_and_fees.fuel_payment_terms: Post-flight settlement available; credit cards accepted
payment_and_fees.landing_fees: Yes - per Port Authority of NY&NJ schedule
payment_and_fees.notes: Transparent fee structure published by PANYNJ. Multiple FBOs allow fee comparison. Jet fuel and 100LL available.

operational_advantages: Proximity to NYC (12 miles to Midtown)
Multiple FBO options with excellent services
summary.crew_considerations: Must understand NYC Class B airspace procedures, Teterboro hotspots, noise abatement rules, and Line Up and Wait procedures. Jet aircraft operators require Pre-Flight coordination. CAT II/III rating recommended for instrument operations.
summary.planning_recommendation: Business hours (08:00-17:00 weekdays) experience moderate congestion; early morning or evening slots more available. Summer thunderstorm season (Jul-Aug) requires flexible scheduling and awareness of potential diversions. Verify aircraft weight under 100,000 lbs ramp weight limit. Comply strictly with noise abatement procedures (3-strike violation policy). Holiday periods (Dec, Thanksgiving, Memorial Day) require advance booking. Winter operations generally manageable with occasional snow impacts.
